Resources

Quick links for tech clubs, setup guides, and ACM basics.

Tech clubs at William & Mary

Explore nearby communities (and collaborators) across campus.

Society of Women in Computing

networking

Community and mentorship supporting women and allies in computing.

GDG on Campus (Developer Student Club)

build

Build apps/sites/scripts and support campus groups and nonprofits.

Tribe Cyber

security

Cybersecurity learning, competition, and community at W&M.

AI Club

ai

Learn AI fundamentals, build projects, and explore research opportunities.

Robotics Club

build

Collaborative, project-based club for building robots and hands-on engineering.

ACM @ W&M FAQ

Answers to the most common questions.

Do I need to be a CS major to join?

No. Anyone can join. We welcome all majors and experience levels.

Where are meetings?

Thursdays at 7:00 PM in ISC 2280.

When are office hours?

Monday–Friday in ISC 2394:
9–11 AM, 3–5 PM, 6–7 PM.

How do I get updates?

Use the Connect page to join Discord/GroupMe and follow socials.

What kinds of events does ACM run?

Workshops, speaker talks, project team meetups, and social events.

Can I suggest an event or give a workshop?

Yes. Message an officer on Discord or GroupMe.
